means: 恶化，变坏( deteriorate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The National Health Service has visibly deteriorated, despite increased spending.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管支出在增加，但国民医疗保健服务的质量却明显下降了。
格兰特的健康状况持续恶化。

sentence.Network_en: Her health deteriorated rapidly, and she died shortly afterwards.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的健康状况急剧恶化，不久便去世了。

entry.def: If something deteriorates, it becomes worse in some way.

example.ex: There are fears that the situation might deteriorate into full-scale war...
example.tran: 人们担心形势可能恶化而演变成一场全面战争。

auth_sentence.content: The last time it deteriorated into a stress fracture.
auth_sentence.res_content: The last time it deteriorated into a stress fracture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The last time it deteriorated into a stress fracture.

auth_sentence.content: But I became increasingly vocal as the situation deteriorated.
auth_sentence.res_content: But I became increasingly vocal as the situation deteriorated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But I became increasingly vocal as the situation deteriorated.

auth_sentence.content: The Washington-Islamabad relationship has deteriorated considerably in recent months.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Washington-Islamabad relationship has deteriorated considerably in recent months.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Washington-Islamabad relationship has deteriorated considerably in recent months.
